assessments.status_rationale: Today’s bullets include a broad NYT piece on Trump’s impact on the federal government but do not report Trump publicly naming a specific intended replacement nominee for Fed Chair Powell. Deadline (2026-01-31) has not yet passed.

CNBC coverage of December 2025 Fed minutes (including a split over a December rate cut) does not establish what the Fed will do at the first two scheduled FOMC meetings of 2026. Those meetings have not occurred yet.

No bullet indicates China’s CAC (or another regulator) has issued draft rules/guidance specifically requiring AI chatbots to implement anti-self-harm measures and mitigate “emotional dependence” risks. Deadline (2026-03-31) has not yet passed.
Today’s SoftBank-related news concerns a fully funded $40B investment in OpenAI, not an announced definitive agreement to acquire DigitalBridge. Deadline (2026-06-30) has not yet passed.

No bullet reports a UN General Assembly resolution explicitly calling on Israel to restore/maintain UNRWA privileges/immunities/operational access with at least 100 votes in favor. Deadline (2026-03-31) has not yet passed.

An NYT item notes Gaza aid groups facing suspensions under new Israeli rules, which may be directionally relevant, but the bullets do not clearly state that UNRWA itself announced a suspension of at least 14 consecutive days citing Israeli restrictions. Deadline (2026-06-30) has not yet passed.

No bullet indicates the U.S. State Department or OMB publicly announced withholding/pausing/conditioning at least $200M in U.S. contributions to UN agencies/programs tied to reform/performance requirements. Deadline (2026-09-30) has not yet passed.
Today’s news bullets do not provide evidence about ICE Brent front-month settling at or above $90/bbl (nor do they report such a settlement). Deadline (2026-03-31) has not yet passed.
No bullet reports a VIX close at or above 35.0. Deadline (2026-06-30) has not yet passed.
